util.logging

Class ConfigurationManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • util.logging.ConfigurationManager

  • public class ConfigurationManager
extends Object
    The ConfigurationManager manages logging configurations as its name describes.
    On of the main purposes of this class is the parsing and interpretation of configuration files for this logging API. Further the management of assigning handlers to loggers is another important part of this class. The two ways of configuring a logger or manager are described further below.

    Default configuration

    This class firstly checks if a system property with key LoggerManager.LOGGING_DISABLED_KEY exists. If such a property was found and equals case insensitive to true, the configuration manager will set the level of each registered handler to Level.OFF (and to handlers which will be registered in future).
    Does said property exist and equals case insensitive to false, then the default logging level will be set to Level.INFO, except a system property named LoggerManager.LOGGING_DEFAULT_LEVEL_KEY does exist. In this case and if that property could get parsed with LevelX.parse(String), that level will be taken as default level.
    Otherwise if no system property is set, but a config file (valid location, valid format) is present the configuration will be loaded from said file. In case such a file does not exist, then the logging is automatically disabled.

    Configuration file

    This logging API provides simple JSON-based config-file system. Configuration files describe handlers by their fully qualified class name. With the reference name handlers can be assigned to loggers which are addressed by their name. Both, handlers and loggers, can have their level set through this configuration.
    The following shows an example of such a configuration file: 
     
 {
 	"version":"dev 0.2",
 	"handlers":[
 		{
 			"ref":"console",
 			"name":"util.logging.StandardConsoleHandler",
 			"level":"DEBUG"
 		}
 	],
 	"loggers":[
 		{
 			"name":"mypackage.MyApp",
 			"handler":"console",
 			"level":"DEBUG"
 		}
 	]
 }

    Configuration file keys

    Key name Description Remark
    version This describes the version of the configuration file. Currently this has to be: dev 0.2 mandatory
    handlers An array of handler JSON objects mandatory
    loggers An array of logger JSON objects mandatory
    hander JSON object Contains the keys name, ref and level, see their descriptions. mandatory
    logger JSON object Contains the keys name, handler and level, see their descriptions. mandatory
    ref A string to reference that handler. It is used in logger.handler to assign a handler to a certain logger. mandatory
    name The full class name of the handler. Or the logger's complete name. mandatory
    level The logger / handler's LevelX. optional
    handler The reference string to a previous defined handler. mandatory

    A developer may use one of the following techniques to register the config file to the API:

    • By setting a system property named with the absolute or relative path to the config file (inclusive name and suffix, e.g. lsjl.json
    • By placing a file in the root folder of the application (so were it gets executed) with one of the following names:
      • lsjl
      • lsjl-config
      • logging
      • logging-config
      And one of the follwing suffixes:
      • .json
      • .cfg
      • .config

    During Runtime

    This way is not yet implemented.

    Author:
    Loris

    • Method Detail

      • getConfigManager

        public static ConfigurationManager getConfigManager()
        Returns the configuration manager instance.
        Returns:
        The configuration manager instance.

      • applyConfig

        public void applyConfig(Logger log)
        Applies the configuration for the given logger. If a config file was found and could get parsed and the given logger has an entry, then it will be configured as defined in the file. Otherwise the default configuration gets applied.
        Parameters:
        log -

      • applyDefaultConfig

        public void applyDefaultConfig(Logger log)
        Applies the default configuration to the given logger. Default means: The level is INFO and one handler, a StandartConsoleHandler gets added.
        Parameters:
        log -

      • getHandlerForRef

        public Handler getHandlerForRef(String ref)
        Returns the Handler with the given reference signature.
        Parameters:
        ref - The reference signature of the handler.
        Returns:
        The handler object or null if none was found.

      • loadConfigFile

        @Deprecated
public void loadConfigFile(String file)
                                 throws IOException
        Deprecated. Since the config mechanism is no more public!
        Loads the config file specified by the given path. It is recommended to give the absolute path - to minimize errors.
        Parameters:
        file -
        Throws:
        IOException

      • registerHandler

        public void registerHandler(String ref,
                            Handler handler)
        Register the given Handler object with the associated reference. This method is designed to register handlers from another class.
        Note: The configuration manager will automatically and silently set the handler's level to Level.OFF if logging is disabled!
        Parameters:
        ref - The reference the handler is identified with, must be not null, not empty and unique.
        handler - The handler to register with the given refernece.
